newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ivory Coast inflation rises 5.9 pct yr-yr in June.
newsitem.headline: Ivory Coast inflation rises 5.9 pct yr-yr in June.

text.p: Consumer prices in Ivory Coast rose by 1.5 percent in June from May, giving a year-on-year inflation rate of 5.9 percent, up from 5.0 percent in May, data from the National Statistics Institute (INS) showed.
This benchmark rate is calculated from separate indices for blue-collar and white-collar workers, accounting respectively for 80 percent and 20 percent of the so-called "combined index".
The INS did not provide any further information on the combined index.
The government has forecast an inflation rate of 5.0 percent for 1997.
The INS published the following provisional data:
BLUE COLLAR INDEX June May June 1996

The INS said both indices were pushed up by a sharp rise in food prices, which had now risen by 7.4 percent for blue-collar workers since the start of the year, and by 5.7 percent for white-collar households. -- Alan Raybould, Abidjan newsroom +225 21 90 90
